  The user must be the owner/manager/collaborator of the file.
  The file must not be locked or safe-edit locked, or the user is an admin.
  The file must have been soft-deleted via DELETE:/rest/files/{id}

  The file is permanently deleted, and its content cannot be retrieved.
  Requests to this file will return 403.

get.summary: Get users with access to a shared file
get.description:
### Description:
  Gets a list of users with access to the specified shared file. Also gets the file metadata, providing context and information about the shared file such as each user's role for accessing the file and the user who shared the file.
### Precondition:
  File sharing must be activated on the system. Must be assigned the `user_view` permission for the shared file.
### Response:
  Returns the list of users with access to the shared file, along with metadata about the shared file.
### Sorting:
  Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | id         | The member ID |
  | userId     | The user ID |
  | groupId    | The group ID |
  | roleId     | The role ID |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Filter results by user ID (UUID).

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Filter results by LDAP group ID.

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: Filter results by role ID.

parameters.name: userId:in

get.description:
### Description:
  Return a list of folder members.
### Precondition:
  User must have `user_view` permission for the folder.
### Response:
  List of folder members are returned.
### Sorting:
  Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | id         | The member ID |
  | userId     | The user ID |
  | groupId    | The group ID |
  | roleId     | The role ID |
  | rank       | The rank of the role |
  | email      | The member's email |

parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity.

parameters.description: Filter results by email address.

parameters.description: Filter results by user ID.

parameters.description: Filter results by group ID.

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: Filter results by role ID.

parameters.name: userId:in
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of user IDs. (Recommended request size <= 100)

parameters.name: groupId:in
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of LDAP Group IDs. (Recommended request size <= 100)

parameters.name: roleId:in
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of role IDs.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by the object type.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sorting options.

parameters.description: Specifies additional fields to include in the response.

get.summary: Return the list of files in a folder
get.description:
### Description:
  Returns the list of files within the specified folder.
### Precondition:
  User must have `properties_view` permission for the folder.
### Response:
  Returns a list of files within the specified folder.
### Sorting:
  Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | name       | The name of the file |
  | created    | The creation datetime of file |
  | modified   | The last modified datetime of file |
  | size       | The file size (for files) |

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the parent folder.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Filter by deletion status. If true, show only deleted items; if false, show non-deleted items; if not specified, show both deleted and non-deleted items.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of file within the folder.

parameters.name: name:contains
parameters.description: Search for files whose names contain the specified characters.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file creator.

parameters.name: userId:in
parameters.description: Search for files created by the specified user IDs. (Recommended request size <= 100)

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Search for files created on the specified date.

parameters.name: created:gt
parameters.description: Search for files created after the specified date.

parameters.name: created:gte
parameters.description: Search for files created on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: created:lt
parameters.description: Search for files created before the specified date.

parameters.name: created:lte
parameters.description: Search for files created on or before the specified date.

parameters.name: modified
parameters.description: Search for files modified on the specified date.

parameters.name: modified:gt
parameters.description: Search for files modified after the specified date.

parameters.name: modified:gte
parameters.description: Search for files modified on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: modified:lt
parameters.description: Search for files modified before the specified date.

parameters.name: modified:lte
parameters.description: Search for files modified on or before the specified date.

parameters.name: expire
parameters.description: Search for files that expire on the specified date.

parameters.name: expire:gt
parameters.description: Search for files that expire after the specified date.

parameters.name: expire:gte
parameters.description: Search for files that expire on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: expire:lt
parameters.description: Search for files that expire before the specified date.

parameters.name: expire:lte
parameters.description: Search for files that expire on or before the specified date.

parameters.name: isPushed
parameters.description: Search for files that have been pushed.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sorting options.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Range limit.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Range offset.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Specifies additional fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Determines the detail level of the response body.

200.description: A list of files in the folder is returned successfully.

get.description:
### Description:
  Gets a list of messages from your mailbox folders: Inbox, Sent & Tracked, Drafts, Trash, and Outbox. For each email, the list contains the email ID, date the email was sent and or sent status.
### Precondition:
  None.
### Response:
  Returns the list of messages in your mail folders.
### Sorting:
  Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | id         | The id of the mail |
  | date       | The sent date of the mail |
  | status     | The current status of the mail |

parameters.name: returnEntity
parameters.description: If true, includes the entity in the response body.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Specifies additional fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Determines the detail level of the response body.

parameters.name: senderId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user who sent the email.

parameters.name: senderId:in
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user who sent the email. Search for results that match any of the specified values of this parameter. (Recommended request size <= 100)

parameters.name: isRecipient
parameters.description: Filter results to include only emails where the current user is a recipient.

parameters.name: read
parameters.description: Filter results based on whether the email has been read by the current user.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Filter results by the email creation date.

parameters.name: date:gt
parameters.description: Filter results created after the specified date.

parameters.name: date:gte
parameters.description: Filters emails created on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: date:lt
parameters.description: Filter emails created before the specified date.

parameters.name: date:lte
parameters.description: Filter emails created on or before the specified date.

parameters.name: modified_date
parameters.description: Filter emails by the last modified date of the email.

parameters.name: modified_date:gt
parameters.description: Filters emails modified after the specified date.

parameters.name: modified_date:gte
parameters.description: Filters emails modified on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: modified_date:lt
parameters.description: Filters emails modified before the specified date.

parameters.name: modified_date:lte
parameters.description: Filters emails modified on or before the specified date.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Indicates whether the email has been deleted.

parameters.name: emailPackageId
parameters.description: Filter results by the unique identifier of the email package.

parameters.name: emailPackageId:in
parameters.description: Filter results by email package identifiers. Matches any of the specified values.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Filter results by the unique identifier of the email template.

parameters.name: templateId:in
parameters.description: Filter results by email template identifiers. Matches any of the specified values.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter results by email status.

parameters.name: isPreview
parameters.description: Filter results to include only preview emails if set to true.

parameters.name: isUserSent
parameters.description: Filter results to include only emails sent by the user if set to true.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Filter results by the email bucket category.

parameters.name: returnCustomWebForm
parameters.description: Includes emails with custom web forms in the results.

parameters.name: customWebFormOnly
parameters.description: Filters results to only include emails with custom web forms.

parameters.name: trackingOnly
parameters.description: Filters results to only include emails with tracking access.

parameters.name: approvalRequestOnly
parameters.description: Filters results to only include emails with approval requests.

parameters.name: webFormId
parameters.description: Filter results by unique identifier of the email web form.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sorting options.

parameters.name: sharedMailboxId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the shared mailbox. Filters results belonging to the shared mailbox.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Range limit.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Range offset.

200.description: Return the list of messages successfully.

delete.description:
### Description:
  Using email IDs, deletes up to 100 draft messages from your Drafts folder.
### Precondition:
  None.
### Response:
  Deletes the draft messages from the Drafts folder.

parameters.name: emailId:in
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs to be processed.

parameters.name: partialSuccess
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the operation will continue for the valid items even if some items result in failure.

204.description: The email messages were successfully deleted.

207.description: Some emaik messages were deleted successfully, while others failed.

403.description:
Forbidden

Possible error codes: ERR_ACCESS_NOT_SENDER, ERR_ACCESS_USER, ERR_ENTITY_EMAIL_IS_SENT, ERR_PROFILE_MAIL_DISABLED, ERR_ENTITY_DELETED

get.description:
### Description:
  Gets the number of messages from your mailbox folders: Inbox, Sent & Tracked, Drafts, Trash, and Outbox.
### Precondition:
  None.
### Response:
  Returns the number of messages in each mail folder.

parameters.name: returnCustomWebForm
parameters.description: Indicates whether to include emails with custom web forms in the result.

200.description: Successfully returns the number of messages in each mail folder.

patch.description:
### Description:
  Using email IDs, deletes messages from your Inbox and Sent folders. Depending on the system retention policy, the messages may be recoverable until permanently deleted by the system.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender or recipient of the messages.
### Response:
  Deletes the messages from your Inbox and Sent folders.

parameters.name: emailId:in
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs to be processed.

parameters.name: partialSuccess
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the operation will continue for the valid items even if some items result in failure.

200.description: The emails were successfully permanently deleted.

207.description: Partially successful operation. Some emails could not be permanently deleted.

get.description: Gets a list of email addresses from a distribution list.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address to check or expand.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Indicates whether to include the email addresses of distribution list members.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: If provided, the distribution list will include only members who have received this specific email.

patch.description:
### Description:
  Using email IDs, marks messages as read in your Inbox.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender or recipient of the messages.
### Response:
  Returns partial or success responses indicating messages that were marked as read.

parameters.name: emailId:in
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs to be processed.

parameters.name: partialSuccess
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the operation will continue for the valid items even if some items result in failure.

200.description: The email messages were successfully marked as read.

207.description: Partially successful operation. Some email messages could not be marked as read.

patch.description:
### Description:
  Using email IDs, recovers deleted messages from your Trash folder.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender or recipient of the messages.
### Response:
  Returns partial or success responses indicating messages that were  moved to the Inbox folder.

parameters.name: emailId:in
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs to be processed.

parameters.name: partialSuccess
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the operation will continue for the valid items even if some items result in failure.

207.description: Partially successful operation. Some emails could not be recovered.

### Description:
  Using email IDs, moves messages from your Inbox and Sent folders to the Trash folder.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender or recipient of the messages.
### Response:
  Deletes the messages from the Inbox and Sent folders.

parameters.name: emailId:in
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs to be processed.

parameters.name: partialSuccess
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the operation will continue for the valid items even if some items result in failure.

200.description: The emails were successfully moved to trash.

207.description: Partially successful operation. Some emails could not be moved to trash.

patch.description:
### Description:
  Using email IDs, marks messages as read in your Inbox.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender or recipient of the messages.
### Response:
  Returns partial or success responses indicating messages that were marked as unread.

parameters.name: emailId:in
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of email IDs to be processed.

post.summary: Withdraw files from a sent message
post.description:
### Description:
  Using an email ID, withdraws specified attachments from the message.
### Notes:
  - The message itself is not withdrawn. Only the links to its file attachments are deactivated so that the files are no longer accessible to the original recipients. The files remain in the system until they expire.
  - If a recipient forwarded the message prior to its withdrawal, links to email attachments remain active for those recipients until the file attachments expire in the system.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender of the message.
### Response:
  Withdraws email attachments from the sent message.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the email.

parameters.name: id:in
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of attachment IDs to be withdrawn.

parameters.name: sharedMailboxId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Shared Mailbox. If provided, the operation will be performed within the specified Shared Mailbox context.

403.description:
Forbidden

Possible error codes: ERR_ACCESS_NOT_SENDER, ERR_ACCESS_USER, ERR_ENTITY_DELETED, ERR_ENTITY_IS_DELETED_ATTACHMENT

delete.summary: Withdraw multiple files from messages in Sent and Drafts folder
delete.description:
### Description:
  Using attachment IDs, withdraws specified attachments from messages in the current user's Sent and Drafts folders.
### Notes:
  - The message itself is not withdrawn. Only the links to its file attachments are deactivated so that the files are no longer accessible to the original recipients. The files remain in the system until they expire.
  - If a recipient forwarded the message prior to its withdrawal, links to email attachments remain active for those recipients until the file attachments expire in the system.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender of the message.
### Response:
  Withdraws email attachments from sent and draft messages.

204.description: The specified attachments were successfully withdrawn.

get.summary: Get email attachments sent by current user
get.description:
### Description:
  Using an email ID, gets a list of files attached to a message in the current user's Inbox or Drafts folder. Includes file metadata.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the current user's messages.
### Response:
  Returns the list of email attachments.
### Sorting:
    Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | id         | The mail id |
  | subject    | The mail subject |
  | sent_date  | The mail sent date |
  | modified_date | The last modified date of the mail |
  | type       | The type of the mail. Can be 'sent', 'draft' or 'request' |
  | size       | The file size |

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Range limit.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Range offset.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Specifies the email bucket to filter attachments from.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sorting order. Default is 'id:desc'.

200.description: The list of email attachments was returned successfully.

post.summary: Withdraw messages from Sent and Drafts folders
post.description:
### Description:
  Using email IDs, withdraws the messages from the current user's Sent and Drafts folders.
### Notes:
  - The message itself is not withdrawn. Only the links to its file attachments are deactivated so that the files are no longer accessible to the original recipients. The files remain in the system until they expire.
  - If a recipient forwarded the message prior to its withdrawal, links to email attachments remain active for those recipients until the file attachments expire in the system.
### Preconditions:
  Must be the sender of the messages.
### Response:
  Withdraws email attachments from the specified messages.

207.description: Partially successful operation, some email messages could not be withdrawn.

get.description:
### Description:
  Returns the list of folder children, where folders are fetched first, followed by files.
### Precondition:
  User must have `properties_view` permission for the folder.
### Response:
  Returns a list of folders and files within the specified folder.
### Sorting:
  Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | name       | The name of the folder or file |
  | created    | The creation datetime of the folder or file |
  | modified   | The last modified datetime of the folder or file |
  | size       | The number of items in the folder (for folders) or the file size (for files) |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Filter by deletion status. If true, show only deleted items; if false, show non-deleted items; if not specified, show both deleted and non-deleted items.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Sorting options.

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of file extensions to include in the filter.

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: A regular expression pattern used to filter files by their names or other attributes.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the folder or file within the folder.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: Filter by a specific file ID.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Range limit.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Range offset.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Specifies additional fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Determines the detail level of the response body.

200.description: Returns the list of folder children.

  Gets a list of files that have been shared with the user. For each file, the file name, size, and date the file was shared is returned.

  and `orderType` for the sort order, which can be either `asc` or `desc`.

get.description:
### Overview:
  Search for files, folders, or emails based on query parameters.
### Precondition:
  - The user must be authenticated.
### Response:
  - Returns a list of matching files, folders, or emails.
### Sorting:
  Sorting can be applied using two query parameters: `orderBy` for the field name,
  and `orderType` for the sort order, which can be either `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting field options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | score      | The search relevance score |
  | name       | The name of the folder or file |
  | created    | The creation datetime of the folder or file |
  | modified   | The last modified datetime of the folder or file |

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Range limit.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Range offset.

parameters.name: includeContent
parameters.description: Indicates whether it is a full-text search or a database search.

parameters.name: searchType
parameters.description: List of comma-separated search types (e.g., files: "f", folders: "d", emails: "e").

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query string.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Search within a specific folder ID.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Exact creation date.

parameters.name: created:gt
parameters.description: Created after the specified date.

parameters.name: created:gte
parameters.description: Created on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: created:lt
parameters.description: Created before the specified date.

parameters.name: created:lte
parameters.description: Created on or before the specified date.

parameters.name: modified

get.description:
### Overview:
  Retrieves the list of admin activities.
### Precondition:
  The user must be an administrator with access to `Activity Log`.
### Response:
  Returns the list of activities performed by the admin.
### Sorting:
  Sort string syntax `FIELD_NAME:ORDER`.

  ORDER can be `asc` or `desc`.
### Sorting options:
  | FIELD_NAME | Description |
  |------------|-------------|
  | created    | The creation date and time of the activity |
  | client     | The client name |
  | username   | The username associated with the activity |
  | ip_address | The client IP address |

post.summary: Uploads a file chunk via the provided upload link
post.description:
### Description:
  This endpoint allows for the upload of a chunk of a file to the server. The file is uploaded in multiple chunks, which are processed individually.
### Precondition:
  * The user must have access to a valid upload link.
  * The client must divide the file into chunks before uploading, especially if the file is large.
  * Chunks must be uploaded sequentially, starting from index 1. Each chunk must be uploaded in the correct order to ensure proper reconstruction of the file.
### Response:
  The file upload is completed and registered on the server after all chunks have been successfully uploaded.

parameters.name: host_name
parameters.description: The upload host name, which can be retrieved from GET /uploads/{id} or the initiateUpload response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the upload.

parameters.name: returnEntity
parameters.description: If true, includes the entity in the response body.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Specifies additional fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Determines the detail level of the response body.

compressionMode.description: The compression mode used for the chunk. Options include "NORMAL", "GZIP", and "ZLIB".

compressionSize.description: The size of the chunk after compression.

originalSize.description: The size of the chunk before compression.

content.description: The binary content of the chunk.

index.description: The sequential index of the chunk (starts from 1).

lastChunk.description: Indicates if this is the last chunk of the file (1 if last, 0 otherwise).

200.description: The current chunk upload is successfully received but not yet registered to the server.

201.description: File uploaded successfully and is registered to the server after the last chunk is received.

acl.description:
Defines the access control level for the email.
`verify_recipient` – Accessible only to specified recipients.
`no_auth` – Public access, no authentication required.
`otp` – Accessible to recipients; allows one-time passcode (OTP) via SMS for authentication.
`internal` – Accessible to recipients and users within the organization.
`anyone_auth` – Accessible to recipients and any authenticated user.
`email_otp` – Accessible to recipients; allows one-time passcode (OTP) via email for authentication.
